Privacy Policy
Privacy Policy
Updated December 2023

1. Introduction to Kolabrya Welcome to Kolabrya. We specialize in enhancing meeting productivity through our AI-driven web application, kolabrya.ai. Our platform is designed to visualize meeting discussions in real-time and generate valuable insights, such as decisions, action items, and summaries from live meetings.
2. Kolabrya.ai - AI Web Application Kolabrya.ai utilizes AI LLM technology to transform the way meetings are conducted, offering a unique and efficient meeting experience.

• Sharing of User Data with Third-Party AI Platforms: Our platform is committed to maintaining transparency in how we handle user data. An essential component of our service involves the use of advanced AI-powered Large Language Models (LLMs) to process and analyze meeting transcriptions. When you use our platform, the content of your meetings, including discussions and the names of participants, is securely transmitted to these AI models for processing. This data is essential for us to provide key features such as real-time transcription, meeting summaries, and analytical insights. We ensure that the sharing of this data is conducted in strict adherence to our privacy standards, with robust measures in place to safeguard your information. Our AI partners are selected based on their commitment to data security and privacy. The use of this data is confined strictly to the stated purposes of enhancing your meeting productivity and is not used for any other form of processing or analysis.  ◦ This data is not used to train AI models​

• Data Collection and Use: We collect calendar information including meeting titles, links, dates, and times and meeting transcriptions. This information, obtained with user consent, is used to schedule the Kolabrya bot for joining meetings and providing our services.
Data Collection and Use

• Integration with Conference Tools: Kolabrya.ai integrates with various conferencing tools such as Google Meet, Zoom, and Microsoft Teams.
Integration with Conference Tools
: Kolabrya.ai integrates with various conferencing tools such as Google Meet, Zoom, and Microsoft Teams.

• Specifically for Google : Kolabrya's use and transfer to any other app of information received from Google APIs will adhere to Google API Services User Data Policy, including the Limited Use requirements and we ensure that this data is accessed and used solely for the purpose of enhancing meeting productivity.

, including the Limited Use requirements and we ensure that this data is accessed and used solely for the purpose of enhancing meeting productivity.
• Data Storage and Security: User data is stored securely in encrypted databases. After meetings, users have the option to delete their data from our systems.
Data Storage and Security
: User data is stored securely in encrypted databases. After meetings, users have the option to delete their data from our systems.

• Data Sharing and Processing: User data is not shared with third parties for marketing purposes. We use Large Language Models (LLMs) to analyze meeting data and generate insights, ensuring that this data does not contribute to the training of these models.
Data Sharing and Processing:

User data is not shared with third parties for marketing purposes. We use Large Language Models (LLMs) to analyze meeting data and generate insights, ensuring that this data does not contribute to the training of these models.

• Data retention : We retain data to provide the advertised services including meeting history, meeting summary, action items, tasks, names of participants, and other features. This information is stored in our secure encrypted data bases as long as the users want. This data can be deleted using delete functionality and deletion will erase all history and logs from our databases. The AI LLM Kolabrya uses retains data including meeting transcription, participant names, meeting title, and time stamps for a period of 30 days to monitor abuse; and this data is deleted after 30 days.

• Data Subject Access Rights: We recognize and respect your rights regarding your personal data. As a user or participant of our platform, you are entitled to exercise the following rights:
Data Subject Access Rights: We recognize and respect your rights regarding your personal data. As a user or participant of our platform, you are entitled to exercise the following rights:

1. Right to Access: You have the right to request access to your personal data that we hold. This includes the right to be informed about the nature of the data being processed, the purposes of processing, and the recipients to whom the data is disclosed.

Right to Access: You have the right to request access to your personal data that we hold. This includes the right to be informed about the nature of the data being processed, the purposes of processing, and the recipients to whom the data is disclosed.
2. Right to Rectification: If you find that any personal data we hold about you is inaccurate or incomplete, you have the right to request corrections or updates to this data.
Right to Rectification: If you find that any personal data we hold about you is inaccurate or incomplete, you have the right to request corrections or updates to this data.
3. Right to Erasure: Under certain conditions, you have the right to request the deletion of your personal data, commonly referred to as the 'right to be forgotten'.
Right to Erasure: Under certain conditions, you have the right to request the deletion of your personal data, commonly referred to as the 'right to be forgotten'.
4. Right to Restriction of Processing: You may request that we restrict the processing of your personal data, which means that your data can only be held by us and not used further.
Right to Restriction of Processing: You may request that we restrict the processing of your personal data, which means that your data can only be held by us and not used further.

5. Right to Data Portability: Where applicable, you have the right to receive the personal data that you have provided to us in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format, and also to request that we transmit this data to another controller.

Right to Data Portability: Where applicable, you have the right to receive the personal data that you have provided to us in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format, and also to request that we transmit this data to another controller.
6. Right to Object: You have the right to object to the processing of your personal data, especially where the processing involves direct marketing.
Right to Object: You have the right to object to the processing of your personal data, especially where the processing involves direct marketing.

3. Limited Use and User Consent Disclosure We adhere to the Google API Services User Data Policy, including the Limited Use requirements. Transparency in our data use practices is paramount, and we obtain explicit user consent for data processing.

4. We receive, collect and store any information you enter on our website or provide us in any other way in the application including voice, meeting transcription. In addition, we collect the Internet protocol (IP) address used to connect your computer to the Internet; login; e-mail address; password; computer and connection information and purchase history. We may use software tools to measure and collect session information, including page response times, length of visits to certain pages, page interaction information, and methods used to browse away from the page. We also collect personally identifiable information (including name, email, password, communications); payment details (including credit card information), comments, feedback, product reviews, recommendations, and personal profile.

5. When you conduct a transaction on our website or application, as part of the process, we collect personal information you give us such as your name, address and email address, meeting transcription, names of participants and meeting title. Your personal information will be used for the specific reasons stated above only.
6. We collect such Non-personal and Personal Information for the following purposes:
1. To provide and operate the Services;
To provide and operate the Services;
2. To provide our Users with ongoing customer assistance and technical support;
To provide our Users with ongoing customer assistance and technical support;
3. To be able to contact our Visitors and Users with general or personalized service-related notices and promotional messages;
To be able to contact our Visitors and Users with general or personalized service-related notices and promotional messages;
4. To create aggregated statistical data and other aggregated and/or inferred Non-personal Information, which we or our business partners may use to provide and improve our respective services;
To create aggregated statistical data and other aggregated and/or inferred Non-personal Information, which we or our business partners may use to provide and improve our respective services;
5. To comply with any applicable laws and regulations.
To comply with any applicable laws and regulations.

7. Our company website is hosted on the Wix.com platform and the application is hosted on Azure. Wix.com provides us with the online platform that allows us to sell our products and services to you. Your data may be stored through Wix.com’s data storage, databases and the general Wix.com applications. They store your data on secure servers behind a firewall. Our application uses a number of 3rd party vendors who may store your meeting information such as transcripts from several days to a month, after which they delete from their servers.

8. All direct payment gateways offered by Wix.com and used by our company adhere to the standards set by PCI-DSS as managed by the PCI Security Standards Council, which is a joint effort of brands like Visa, MasterCard, American Express and Discover. PCI-DSS requirements help ensure the secure handling of credit card information by our store and its service providers.

9. We may contact you to notify you regarding your account, to troubleshoot problems with your account, to resolve a dispute, to collect fees or monies owed, to poll your opinions through surveys or questionnaires, to send updates about our company, or as otherwise necessary to contact you to enforce our User Agreement, applicable national laws, and any agreement we may have with you. For these purposes we may contact you via email, telephone, text messages, and postal mail.
10. If you don’t want us to process your data anymore, please contact us at
info@kolabrya.com
info@kolabrya.com

11. We reserve the right to modify this privacy policy at any time and update every year, so please review it frequently. Changes and clarifications will take effect immediately upon their posting on the website. If we make material changes to this policy, we will notify you here that it has been updated, so that you are aware of what information we collect, how we use it, and under what circumstances, if any, we use and/or disclose it.
12. If you would like to: access, correct, amend or delete any personal information we have about you, you are invited to contact us at i
nfo@kolabrya.com.
nfo@kolabrya.com.
